# react/jsx-no-undef <Badge type="info" text="Correctness" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="default-on" type="success">
<span class="emoji">âœ…</span> This rule is turned on by default.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Disallow undeclared variables in JSX

### Why is this bad?

It is most likely a potential ReferenceError caused by a misspelling of a variable or parameter name.

### Example

```jsx
const A = () => <App />;
const C = <B />;
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny react/jsx-no-undef
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "rules": {
    "react/jsx-no-undef": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
